title: TVLine Items: 1923 Adds The Chosen Alum, Invincible Trailer and More
description: 1923 has chosen a new cast member from The Chosen: Andy Dispensa will play a recurring role in Season 2 of the Paramount+ Western, our sister site Variety reports. Dispensa — who appeared as Dion on The CW’s Biblical drama The Chosen — will play Luca, “a young man working in the engine room of a merchant […]
author: Dave Nemetz
excerpt: 'The Chosen' alum Andy Dispensa is joining the Season 2 cast of the Paramount+ Western '1923' — get the scoop on his character.
text: 1923 has chosen a new cast member from The Chosen: Andy Dispensa will play a recurring role in Season 2 of the Paramount+ Western, our sister site Variety reports. Dispensa — who appeared as Dion on The CW’s Biblical drama The Chosen — will play Luca, “a young man working in the engine room of a merchant ship,” per the official description. He joins a cast that already features Harrison Ford, Helen Mirren, Brandon Sklenar, Julia Schlaepfer and more. In Season 2 of 1923 (premiering Sunday, Feb. 23), “a cruel winter brings new challenges and unfinished business to Jacob and Cara back at Dutton ranch. With harsh conditions and adversaries threatening to end the Dutton legacy, Spencer embarks on an arduous journey home, racing against time to save his family in Montana. Meanwhile, Alexandra sets off on her own harrowing trans-Atlantic journey to find Spencer and reclaim their love.” Ready for some more recent newsy nuggets? Well… * Red One, the big-screen holiday adventure starring Dwayne “The Rock” Johnson and Chris Evans, will be available to stream on Prime Video this Thursday, Dec. 12, the streamer announced. * Jaime Camil (Jane the Virgin) will return to NBC’s Lopez vs. Lopez in January to reprise his role as Rosie’s unfaithful ex Josué, per Variety. * Netflix has released its talent lineup for its Christmas Day NFL coverage, which kicks off at 11 am ET with a pre-game show featuring Kay Adams, Drew Brees, Robert Griffin III, Mina Kimes and Manti Te’o (in Los Angeles), and Laura Rutledge, Devin McCourty and Jason McCourty (in Pittsburgh). Ian Eagle, Nate Burleson and JJ Watt will call the Chiefs/Steelers game at 1 pm, with Melanie Collins and Stacey Dales on the sidelines. Then at 4:30 pm for Ravens/Texans, Noah Eagle and Greg Olsen will be in the booth, with Jamie Eddahl and Steve Wyches on the sidelines. * Ali Vitali will take over as anchor of MSNBC’s morning news program Way Too Early, replacing Jonathan Lemire, beginning Jan. 6, according to Variety. * Prime Video has released the official trailer for Season 3 of the animated superhero series Invincible, premiering Thursday, Feb. 6: Which of today’s TVLine Items pique your interest?
html:
1923 has chosen a new cast member from The Chosen: Andy Dispensa will play a recurring role in Season 2 of the Paramount+ Western, our sister site Variety reports.

Dispensa — who appeared as Dion on The CW’s Biblical drama The Chosen — will play Luca, “a young man working in the engine room of a merchant ship,” per the official description. He joins a cast that already features Harrison Ford, Helen Mirren, Brandon Sklenar, Julia Schlaepfer and more.

In Season 2 of 1923 (premiering Sunday, Feb. 23), “a cruel winter brings new challenges and unfinished business to Jacob and Cara back at Dutton ranch. With harsh conditions and adversaries threatening to end the Dutton legacy, Spencer embarks on an arduous journey home, racing against time to save his family in Montana. Meanwhile, Alexandra sets off on her own harrowing trans-Atlantic journey to find Spencer and reclaim their love.”

Ready for some more recent newsy nuggets? Well…

* Red One, the big-screen holiday adventure starring Dwayne “The Rock” Johnson and Chris Evans, will be available to stream on Prime Video this Thursday, Dec. 12, the streamer announced.

* Jaime Camil (Jane the Virgin) will return to NBC’s Lopez vs. Lopez in January to reprise his role as Rosie’s unfaithful ex Josué, per Variety.

* Netflix has released its talent lineup for its Christmas Day NFL coverage, which kicks off at 11 am ET with a pre-game show featuring Kay Adams, Drew Brees, Robert Griffin III, Mina Kimes and Manti Te’o (in Los Angeles), and Laura Rutledge, Devin McCourty and Jason McCourty (in Pittsburgh). Ian Eagle, Nate Burleson and JJ Watt will call the Chiefs/Steelers game at 1 pm, with Melanie Collins and Stacey Dales on the sidelines. Then at 4:30 pm for Ravens/Texans, Noah Eagle and Greg Olsen will be in the booth, with Jamie Eddahl and Steve Wyches on the sidelines.

* Ali Vitali will take over as anchor of MSNBC’s morning news program Way Too Early, replacing Jonathan Lemire, beginning Jan. 6, according to Variety.

* Prime Video has released the official trailer for Season 3 of the animated superhero series Invincible, premiering Thursday, Feb. 6:

Which of today’s TVLine Items pique your interest?
